intro: Fadogia thamnus, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and forest edges. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years. Fadogia thamnus is also noted for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
